lucaswhit

incredible, you may want to branch at tragic potion. your Endurance is likely very low (i didnt see any taken up to level 13) and having 20 pts of health every fight would help you more than the addition of tragic potion at this stage of the game. and i'm sure you're aware that if you come across a heavy weapon brute , yours won't even get the chance at using potion. 6th sense is an ok skill for brutes with a lot of length weapons (baton,lance,trident, halberd, whip) but you've only got baton, and baton 6th senses by itself enough that the skill isn't needed. extra flail hits are fun, but i think you'd be better served with stat boosters here. Armor and Tough skin stack together, but does a +5 armor brute need another +2 pts of armor? i feel like a better set of skills await your brute if you fork in the teens.

Maybe it's too late, but pick up shuriken; if you are offered shuriken before any other weapon, you should keep only it. But it doesn't hurt to choose it as a second weapon, since your axe can be disarmed by shock, sabotage or iron head, or maybe your brute just discards it. Even if your brute picks shuriken first, it will throw a couple of them before changing it into axe.

So, if there's still time, pick up shuriken, you won't regret it.

Sai is one of the best weapons in the game. you HAVE to take SAI. Sai gives extra speed and blocks regularly, it will multi-hit frequently and features 100% shock to your opponents (destroy drawn weapon) so it will save you by blocking and will disarm your opponent's killer weapon. 15 strength will be great for you for a long time, so you can comfortably take this as your solo weapon for 7 levels or so giving you more speed, agility, and endurance. you will pass up on 20 pts of life , but you will gain it back many, many times over in every phase of the game

Gordzilla
IndianHoeOwnerWhy? You can have 3 right? So the best would be Vitality - Herc Str - Fel Agi I assume. So why pass on Vit if it's the first one offered?

If you pass on ANY stat booster you may be offered another pretty soon. I normally pass on Lightening Bolt and then I may get offered Herc Strength or Feline agility. Which I take. Then you sit and wait to be offered more stat boosters, which can take a lot of level ups. If you accept Vitality as your first stat booster, then you may be waiting another 20 levels before being offered another one.

Statistics too.

Just because you attack more often, it doesn't mean you will be more accurate. Besides, one thing is hitting an opponent and causing 100 damage at once. I'm here!

First, calculate your base speed (speed without skills). As 56 (or 56.5) cannot be divided by 1.5 evenly, your brute's speed should be 57. (check it again! or do you have armor?)

Solve this formula: (b + 3) * 150% = 57
You get b = 35 (wow so much already!)

Now calculate the speed after getting recon:
Speed = (35 + 3 + 5) * 150% * 250% = 161.25 = 161 (rounded down)

[4900381]

+3 strength FOR SURE!


Mammoth bone adds nothing to your build. You have weapons master so wait for sword, broadsword, scimitar or one of the top tier weapons (refer to the tier list 3 thread).


If your STR is high enough, you will hit for damage even without MA. And MA may still come along; it's fairly common.


I assume you got shuriken after knife? If so, you can re-level and choose to not take shuriken. It doesn't work too well if you already have other weapons (although it's not bad). If you got knife after shuriken, then re-level and take no other weapons except shuriken and wait for MA.


Your build is pretty good, so you could just keep it the way it is. You have WM, FoF and relentless which all improve the knife.. You just need some more strength and you'll be surprised at how hard knife actually hits.

theamature

what are the defference between hostility and CA?
On march 26, 2013
k0l3
Iced Guardian

hostility activates when you got hit, and CA when you block
On march 26, 2013
theamature
k0l3hostility activates when you got hit, and CA when you block

now i know thanks

On march 26, 2013
FallenRico
vazelarhozwhat are the defference between hostility and CA?

CA kicks in everytime you block an attack, right after it.

Hostility has a 33% chance of kicking in, but it doesn't stop multi-hits. It may activate after you block, dodge or after a successful hit.
On march 26, 2013
theamature
FallenRicoCA kicks in everytime you block an attack, right after it.

Hostility has a 33% chance of kicking in, but it doesn't stop multi-hits. It may activate after you block, dodge or after a successful hit.
